intro: Lagotis clarkei, commonly known as Clarke's lagotis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
